label: section-title
text: Production Trends

label: section-title
text: As depicted in the visual representation, the total production has exhibited an upward

label: section-title
text: trend over the specified period, reaching its peak in 2011. Subsequently, favorable

label: section-title
text: outcomes were observed in 2013. However, in 2015, production experienced a

label: section-title
text: significant decline, reaching an all-time low. Similar trends are observed in the

label: section-title
text: number of crops sown, with figures peaking between 2000 and 2005, reaching a high

label: section-title
text: of 16.67 thousand, before declining to a low of 0.56 thousand in 2015.

label: section-title
text: Crop Categories

label: section-title
text: As depicted in the chart above, the top three grown categories are as follows: Cereals

label: section-title
text: with 2 million units, constituting 22.72% of the total; Pulses with 2 million units,

label: section-title
text: accounting for 20.89%; and Unknown with 1 million units, representing 14.96% of the

label: section-title
text: total. Conversely, Cash Crops and Others comprise less than 5% each, signifying their

label: section-title
text: comparatively lower contribution to the overall distribution.
